00059 #ifndef HEADER_DH_H
00060 #define HEADER_DH_H

00062 #ifdef OPENSSL_NO_DH
00063 #error DH is disabled.
00064 #endif
00065 
00066 #ifndef OPENSSL_NO_BIO
00067 #include <openssl/bio.h>
00068 #endif
00069 #include <openssl/bn.h>
00070 #include <openssl/crypto.h>
00071 #include <openssl/ossl_typ.h>
00072     
00073 #define DH_FLAG_CACHE_MONT_P    0x01

00076 extern "C" {
00077 #endif

00079 typedef struct dh_st DH;
00080 
00081 typedef struct dh_method {
00082     const char *name;
00083     /* Methods here */
00084     int (*generate_key)(DH *dh);
00085     int (*compute_key)(unsigned char *key,const BIGNUM *pub_key,DH *dh);
00086     int (*bn_mod_exp)(const DH *dh, BIGNUM *r, const BIGNUM *a,
00087                 const BIGNUM *p, const BIGNUM *m, BN_CTX *ctx,
00088                 BN_MONT_CTX *m_ctx); /* Can be null */
00089 
00090     int (*init)(DH *dh);
00091     int (*finish)(DH *dh);
00092     int flags;
00093     char *app_data;
00094 } DH_METHOD;
00095 
00096 struct dh_st
00097     {
00098     /* This first argument is used to pick up errors when
00099      * a DH is passed instead of a EVP_PKEY */
00100     int pad;
00101     int version;
00102     BIGNUM *p;
00103     BIGNUM *g;
00104     long length; /* optional */
00105     BIGNUM *pub_key;    /* g^x */
00106     BIGNUM *priv_key;   /* x */
00107 
00108     int flags;
00109     char *method_mont_p;
00110     /* Place holders if we want to do X9.42 DH */
00111     BIGNUM *q;
00112     BIGNUM *j;
00113     unsigned char *seed;
00114     int seedlen;
00115     BIGNUM *counter;
00116 
00117     int references;
00118     CRYPTO_EX_DATA ex_data;
00119     const DH_METHOD *meth;
00120     ENGINE *engine;
00121     };

00123 #define DH_GENERATOR_2      2
00124 /* #define DH_GENERATOR_3   3 */
00125 #define DH_GENERATOR_5      5

00127 /* DH_check error codes */
00128 #define DH_CHECK_P_NOT_PRIME        0x01
00129 #define DH_CHECK_P_NOT_SAFE_PRIME   0x02
00130 #define DH_UNABLE_TO_CHECK_GENERATOR    0x04
00131 #define DH_NOT_SUITABLE_GENERATOR   0x08
00132 
00133 /* primes p where (p-1)/2 is prime too are called "safe"; we define
00134    this for backward compatibility: */
00135 #define DH_CHECK_P_NOT_STRONG_PRIME DH_CHECK_P_NOT_SAFE_PRIME

00137 #define DHparams_dup(x) (DH *)ASN1_dup((int (*)())i2d_DHparams, \
00138         (char *(*)())d2i_DHparams,(char *)(x))
00139 #define d2i_DHparams_fp(fp,x) (DH *)ASN1_d2i_fp((char *(*)())DH_new, \
00140         (char *(*)())d2i_DHparams,(fp),(unsigned char **)(x))
00141 #define i2d_DHparams_fp(fp,x) ASN1_i2d_fp(i2d_DHparams,(fp), \
00142         (unsigned char *)(x))
00143 #define d2i_DHparams_bio(bp,x) (DH *)ASN1_d2i_bio((char *(*)())DH_new, \
00144         (char *(*)())d2i_DHparams,(bp),(unsigned char **)(x))
00145 #ifdef  __cplusplus
00146 #define i2d_DHparams_bio(bp,x) ASN1_i2d_bio((int (*)())i2d_DHparams,(bp), \
00147         (unsigned char *)(x))
00148 #else
00149 #define i2d_DHparams_bio(bp,x) ASN1_i2d_bio(i2d_DHparams,(bp), \
00150         (unsigned char *)(x))
00151 #endif
